It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its distinctive, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale purple, often arranged in clusters. Jaltomata spooneri is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It is a perennial shrub that is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
